definition: literary inquisition/official persecution of intellectuals for their writing
language/culture/writing/formal/literary/gentle/(old) classifier for coins/Kangxi radical 67
surname Wen
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
prison

sentences.english: Literary inquisition in the Qing Dynasty is known as its large number, its large scale, and its great cruelty.
sentences.chinese: 清代文字獄以次數多，規模大，懲處之殘酷著稱於世。

sentences.english: Literary inquisition of the Qing Dynasty is known for its large number, large scale, and cruelty.
sentences.chinese: 清代文字獄以次數多，規模大，懲處之殘酷著稱於世。

sentences.english: The Qing Dynasty is our country literary inquisition most dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 清代是我國文字獄最多的朝代。

sentences.english: The third part talks over the social politics' influence on language from literary inquisition direction.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分討論從文字獄看社會政治對語言的影響。

sentences.english: However, a study of literary inquisition began at the end of the Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 但真正意義上對清代文字獄的研究則從清代滅亡開始。

sentences.english: However, in the true sense, the studies on literary inquisition began in the doom of the Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 但真正意義上對清代文字獄的研究則從清代滅亡開始。

definition: scholar of the rationalist school of Neo-Confucianism 理學|理学[Li3 xue2]
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to make a catalogue/catalogue/list
to broadcast a time signal
to write a book advancing one's theory (idiom)
centralized power (history), e.g. under an Emperor or party
to write for sb else/a lawyer who writes legal documents for his clients
rime dictionary (ancient type of Chinese dictionary that collates characters by tone and rhyme rather than by radical)
respect for the wise
to engage in wars of aggression at will (idiom)/militaristic/bellicose
autocracy/dictatorship
Manchukuo
unification (of the nation)/large scale unification
Tao Zongyi (c. 1329-1410), Yuan dynasty scholar
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
